course_title: Special Topics In Music History: Jazz and the Civil Right Era
class_notes: This course presents a history of jazz, especially c.1954 -76, through the lens of segregation, the American political imagination, and the Civil Rights Movement as reflected in the music of musicians like Duke Ellington, Max Roach, and Nina Simone while exploring how textless music can be political.
course_description: Study of a selected topic in Western music history.
prerequisites: This requisite mandates Mus_OX 101 as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3723, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: J. Rosenholtz-Witt, Status: Open
